events.originalText: The Sri Lanka Army killed Velupillai Prabhakaran, the leader and founder of the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam, to bring an end to the 26-year Sri Lankan Civil War.
events.subtitle: Sri Lanka Army
events.headline: Velupillai Prabhakaran killed by Sri Lanka Army, ending 26-year Civil War

events.originalText: The Parliament of Nepal unanimously voted to strip King Gyanendra of many of his powers.
events.subtitle: Federal Parliament of Nepal
events.headline: Nepal Parliament strips King Gyanendra of powers

events.originalText: Ireland won the Eurovision song contest for the seventh time, the highest number of wins for any country before Sweden tied it in 2023.
events.subtitle: Republic of Ireland
events.headline: Ireland wins Eurovision for 7th time before Sweden ties record

events.originalText: India conducted its first nuclear test explosion at Pokhran, the first confirmed nuclear test by a nation outside the five permanent members of the United Nations Security Council.
events.subtitle: Smiling Buddha
events.headline: India conducts first nuclear test at Pokhran

events.originalText: Eli Cohen, a spy who is credited with gathering significant intelligence used by Israel during the Six-Day War, was publicly hanged in Syria.
events.subtitle: Eli Cohen
events.headline: Spy Eli Cohen hanged in Syria after Six-Day War intelligence

events.originalText: Operation Passage to Freedom, the evacuation of 310,000 Vietnamese civilians, soldiers and non-Vietnamese members of the French Army from communist North Vietnam to South Vietnam following the end of the First Indochina War, ended.
events.subtitle: Operation Passage to Freedom
events.headline: Operation Passage to Freedom evacuates 310,000 Vietnamese

events.originalText: First Indochina War: Viet Minh forces overran a French and Laotian garrison at Muong Khoua, leaving only four survivors.
events.subtitle: First Indochina War
events.headline: Viet Minh forces overrun French garrison at Muong Khoua

events.originalText: The Soviet Union forcibly deported hundreds of thousands of Crimean Tatars to the Uzbek SSR and elsewhere in the country.
events.subtitle: Deportation of the Crimean Tatars
events.headline: Soviet Union forcibly deports Crimean Tatars

events.originalText: In a crime that captivated Japan, Sada Abe (pictured) strangled her lover, cut off his genitals, and carried them around with her for several days until her arrest.
events.subtitle: Sada Abe
events.headline: Sada Abe strangles lover in Japan crime

events.originalText: U.S. president Franklin D. Roosevelt signed an act establishing the Tennessee Valley Authority to stimulate the economic development of the Tennessee Valley, a region particularly impacted by the Great Depression.
events.subtitle: Franklin D. Roosevelt
events.headline: FDR establishes Tennessee Valley Authority to stimulate economy

events.originalText: Disgruntled school board treasurer Andrew Kehoe set off explosives with timers and a rifle (aftermath pictured), causing the Bath School disaster in the Bath Consolidated School in Michigan, killing 44 people in the deadliest mass murder in a school in United States history.
events.subtitle: Board of education
events.headline: Andrew Kehoe causes Bath School disaster, killing 44

events.originalText: Pentecostal evangelist Aimee Semple McPherson was reportedly kidnapped near Venice Beach in Los Angeles before reappearing five weeks later in Mexico.
events.subtitle: Pentecostalism
events.headline: Aimee Semple McPherson reportedly kidnapped in Los Angeles

events.originalText: Ruling in the landmark decision Plessy v. Ferguson, the U.S. Supreme Court upheld the legality of racial segregation in public transportation under the "separate but equal" doctrine.
events.subtitle: List of landmark court decisions in the United States
events.headline: Plessy v. Ferguson upholds racial segregation in public transportation

events.originalText: American Civil War: General Ulysses S. Grant led his Army of the Tennessee across the Big Black River in preparation for the Siege of Vicksburg.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: General Grant crosses Big Black River in Civil War

events.originalText: An earthquake measuring .mw-parser-output .tooltip-dotted{border-bottom:1px dotted;cursor:help}Ms7.8 struck Shanxi Province in northern China, resulting in at least 52,600 deaths.
events.subtitle: 1695 Linfen earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake in Shanxi Province, China kills at least 52,600

events.originalText: At the Battle of Buir Lake, a Ming Chinese army led by general Lan Yu defeated the forces of Tögüs Temür, the Mongol khan of Northern Yuan.
events.subtitle: Battle of Buir Lake
events.headline: Ming Chinese army defeats Mongol forces at Battle of Buir Lake

events.originalText: Armed insurrectionists massacred the occupying French garrison in Bruges, Flanders, killing approximately 2,000 people.
events.subtitle: Matins of Bruges
events.headline: Insurrectionists massacre French garrison in Bruges, Flanders
